Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: There have been no bugs reported that I can see. I am going to sync some chains with notarypay_new branch and make sure its still compatible. I think also the speical miner will need to be skipped for non notarypay chains.  Then I will merge latest upstream from FSM down.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content:
It looks like I can pretty easily define a new wallet just for staking, but it will definatly break the staking script lol... So I need to start a new branch to work out of for that. It seems much easier to just stake with a seperate wallet than try and use a sperate wallet for notary node address. 
Also we will finally be able to PoW daemon mine and stake at the same time. If I can get this working, I think it solves securing 0BR chains in a reliable way. As all notary nodes can mine and stake them without affecting notary node preformance. Makes little sense to need to run multiple copies of the entie blockchain if we don't have to.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Now this does mean that notaries will have to be trusted to mine the chains, as they will only get paid for notarizations and transaction fees. So they can simply not mine them. Hopefully this doesnt happen, and there is enough miners on each chain to keep them moving  along.

Content:
`curl -s --url "http://127.0.0.1:7776/" --data "{\"agent\":\"dpow\",\"method\":\"ipaddrs\"}" | jq -r .[]` 
This returns all known IPs from iguana btw. Then you can ping them or telnet the iguana port to see if they are online. üòÉ
